text: The DigitalHome Software Requirements Specification (SRS) is based on the DigitalHome Customer Need Statement.

This initial version of DigitalHome will be a limited prototype version, which will be used by HomeOwner management to make business decisions about the future commercial development of DigitalHomeOwner products and services.
The product is based on the Digital Home High Level Requirements Definition.
To make marketing and development decisions, the following sections describe operational environment concerns and constraints.
The system shall include security sound and light alarms, which can be activated when DigitalHome senses a security breach from a magnetic contact.

Each DigitalHome shall contain a master control device (the DigitalHome Gateway Device) that connects to the home’s broadband Internet connection, and uses wireless communication to send and receive communication between the DigitalHome system and the home devices and systems.

Requirements: send and receive communication

text: A DigitalHome user shall be able to read the humidity at a humidistat position.

For a given month and year, a user shall be able to create or modify a month plan that specifies for each day, for up to four daily time periods, the environmental parameter settings (temperature, humidity, contact sensors and power switches).
The ASPERA-3 Processing and Archiving Facility (APAF) is a ground data system responsible for processing all of the ASPERA-3 telemetry.

text: In addition, validation and archiving of all ASPERA-3 scientific data in the NASA Planetary Data System (PDS) within 6 months of receipt in a form useable by the general scientific community is to be provided by the APAF.
The requirements of the APAF data system are categorized and defined in Section 3.
Section 4 contains general information to aid in the understanding of this specification.
The APAF ground data system requirements are categorized according to functional areas and are defined in the following sections in table format.
There shall be a UNIX-based APAF system production computer with an archival system.

text: The SRS will include the details of the system's requirements, interface, design issues, and components.
The target clients for our software are students in the sixth grade and their teacher.
Internet skills that will enable them to use this software.
The Space Fractions system requires a web browser capable of running Flash movies.
There is an option to skip the introduction, if desired.
Claire will be assured that the students will know what to do from this main screen.
The last scene will be determined by the user's response on certain critical questions that impact the story's plot, and an option to try again will be presented.
These inputs will be in the form of two integers representing the numerator and denominator of a fraction.
The output of this process is the adjusted velocity of the spaceship, represented as a decimal value.

The output timing is immediate, ensuring responsive gameplay. The range of output values is determined by the game's physics rules and the maximum and minimum velocity constraints set within the Space Fractions system.
The system continuously listens for a mouse click event during the playback.
If the player opts to start the Space Fractions system, the system transitions to the game sequence, where gameplay begins immediately.
This sequence is designed to challenge and educate players on fractions while advancing the plot, thereby keeping the educational content engaging and contextually relevant.

Requirements: to challenge and educate players on fractions

text: Players interact with this component by responding to the displayed questions.
This method ensures a straightforward and accessible approach for users to demonstrate their understanding and apply their knowledge of fractions.

For incorrect answers, the player is informed of the mistake and given another opportunity to answer the question, albeit without the possibility of earning points for that question, fostering a learning environment that encourages understanding through trial and error.
After completing a predetermined set of questions, the player is directed to the concluding scene of the game, providing closure to the educational journey.
Additionally, the sequence customizes the storyline's progression based on the player's performance at critical junctures, offering a dynamic and personalized gaming experience.
Feedback is provided after each question to help players understand their performance and learn from their mistakes, reinforcing the educational goals of the game.
Player interaction with the ending scene is facilitated through mouse clicks, allowing them to choose between exiting the system or returning to the main menu.
This simple, intuitive input method ensures that players of all ages and skill levels can easily make their selection without confusion or frustration.
This step is crucial for maintaining the quality and integrity of the system content. Once the data passes the validation process, the update for that specific question is finalized.
Players interact with the Math Umbrella through a series of links.
CRIME & CRIMINAL TRACKING NETWORK AND SYSTEMS (CCTNS)

records room staff and citizens

enhancement request

text: Ideally, each error message will be accompanied by explanatory text and an indication of the action(s) which the user can take in response to the error.

Minimizing navigation effort: The number of navigation steps needed to reach a certain piece of content should be minimized as long as different mental models, navigation strategies and tasks of the user are taken into account.
Designing for input device independence: User interfaces should be designed to allow activation of controls by a variety of input devices.

Requirements: to allow activation of controls

text: The ability to choose between different input devices for activating controls such as links, fields and buttons is important both for users who prefer a certain input mode, mobile users and users with disabilities.
This encompasses being able to present content containing newer technologies by older user agents as well as designing content to be usable with future technologies.
Minimizing user errors: Potential user errors as well as the effort needed to recover from errors should be minimized.

Typical action types in user interfaces include manipulating application data, performing searches, communication actions, such as opening a new e-mail window or starting a chat function, and presentation-related actions, such as sorting a list of search results.

Individualization and user adaptation : Adapting the content and the navigation of a user interface to individual users or user groups can be a useful mechanism for providing information that is of interest to the users and for making access to relevant information more efficient.

Requirements: making access to relevant information more efficient

requirements constraints: making access to relevant information more efficient

text: Making individualization and adaptation evident: It should be made evident to the user when individualization and/or adaptation are used.

The CCTNS system is considered to be down if any user is unable to perform any normal System function and if this failure is attributed to any component of the CCTNS system other than the workstation.
The CCTNS system should be designed for access through browser-based systems and must impose minimal requirements on the client device
The CCTNS system should have capability to support public access to a subset of data and functionality

Requirements: to support public access to a subset of data and functionality

requirements constraints: to support public access to a subset of data and functionality

text: The Correlator Monitor and Control System shall receive configuration information from the VLA Expansion Project Monitor and Control System system and translate this info into a physical correlator hardware configuration.

text: The Correlator Monitor and Control System shall monitor correlator and correlator subsystem health and take corrective action autonomously to recover from hardware and computing system faults.

Machine Domain: The Correlator Monitor and Control System
Requirements: monitor correlator and correlator subsystem health
recover from hardware and computing system faults

requirements reference: The Correlator Monitor and Control System
monitor correlator and correlator subsystem health

text: The Correlator Monitor and Control System shall allow for easy system access to aid testing and debugging.

Machine Domain: The Correlator Monitor and Control System

text: Specific data sets required by the Backend Data Processing System will be provided in a timely and robust fashion over a secondary virtual network.

The ability of the Correlator System to achieve and maintain high reliability and uptime will be vitally dependent upon reliable operation and rapid diagnosis and repair of faults in the hardware and software systems.

Where applicable, all computers and peripherals shall be powered though UPS type devices with sufficient capacity for the computers to safely coordinate a system wide shutdown of the correlator hardware in the event of a prolonged power outage.
Error messages will be stamped with their discovery time, control messages will be stamped with their generation time.

A Graphical User Interface shall be provided as an interface to the Correlator Monitor and Control System test software that allows for a convenient and configurable tool to access the Correlator Monitor and Control System remotely through the VCI.
All system processing and interconnect hardware shall be readily accessible for maintenance, repair, replacement and reconfiguration.
They should be organized such that all inputs and outputs can be simulated if necessary.
All software processes shall be killable, restartable, debuggable and testable with minimal impact on normal system operations.
In order to monitor all past access to the EVLA Correlator Monitor and Control System, all attempts to access the EVLA Correlator Monitor and Control System should be logged.

text: Tactical Control System (TCS) System/Subsystem Specification

This TACTICAL CONTROL SYSTEM (TCS) - SYSTEM / SUBSYSTEM SPECIFICATION (SSS) - VERSION 1.0 identifies, specifies, and establishes the detailed system requirements for the Tactical control system as set forth by the OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS DOCUMENT FOR THE UNMANNED AERIAL VEHICLE (UAV) TACTICAL CONTROL SYSTEM (TCS) - VERSION 5.0.
The Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Joint Project Office (UAV JPO) has undertaken development of a Tactical Control System for UAVs.

Environment Entity: The Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Joint Project Office

interface: The Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Joint Project Office

text: Phase 1 will be a 24 month period and will demonstrate Level 1 through Level 5 interaction (as defined below) in an Incremental and Evolutionary strategy as described in accordance with MIL-STD-498.

The Tactical Control System consists of the software, software-related hardware and the extra ground support hardware necessary for the control of the Outrider, and the Predator UAV, and future tactical UAVs.
The major focus of the Tactical Control System program is software.
Software developed will be Defense Information Infrastructure / Common Operating Environment (DII/COE) compliant, non-proprietary, and the architectural standard for all future tactical UAVs.
To the extent possible, the Tactical Control System will use standard DoD components in order to achieve commonality.

Requirements: achieve commonality

text: The Tactical Control System hardware must be scaleable or modular to meet varying Service needs.

Requirements: meet varying Service needs

text: The Tactical Control System will be connected with Advanced Field Artillery Tactical Data System (AFATDS).

Design Domain: Advanced Field Artillery Tactical Data System

interface: Advanced Field Artillery Tactical Data System

text: The Tactical Control System will be connected with Closed Circuit Television (CCTV)
The Tactical Control System states shall not exist concurrently.
In the Normal Operations Mode the Tactical Control System shall support target coordinate development.

Requirements: support target coordinate development

text: In the Maintenance Operations Mode, if computer workstation Human Computer Interface (HCI) is required, the Tactical Control System shall perform fault detection/location (FD/L).

Requirements: perform fault detection/location (FD/L)

text: The Tactical Control System will allow the operator to conduct mission planning.

Requirements: to conduct mission planning

text: The Tactical Control System shall have the functionality to transmit UAV mission plans to service specific mission planning systems.

The Tactical Control System shall provide the system functionality necessary to upload a flight route plan and payload plan (if applicable) to the AV via the selected system data link as well as direct ground connection.
The Tactical Control System shall provide the capability to override validation faults after the fault is acknowledged by the operator.
The Flight Route Plan, as a minimum, shall include AV flight path information, Loss of Link plan, AV VCR control tasking (if applicable to the selected AV), and data link control information.
The Tactical Control System shall provide the capability to display waypoint data in alphanumeric format.
The Tactical Control System shall display an icon indicating AV position when receiving downlink from the desired AV.
The Tactical Control System shall provide the system functionality necessary to generate a payload plan.
The Tactical Control System shall be capable of being interoperable with Predator and Outrider UAVs across the 5 levels of UAV interaction.

Requirements: interoperable with Predator and Outrider UAVs across the 5 levels of UAV interaction

requirements reference: interoperable with Predator and Outrider UAVs across the 5 levels of UAV interaction
interoperable with Predator and Outrider UAVs across the 5 levels of UAV interaction

text: AV telemetry data shall be available to support other Tactical Control System functions as required.

Requirements: support other Tactical Control System functions as required

requirements reference: support other Tactical Control System functions as required
support other Tactical Control System functions as required

text: Tactical Control System shall provide the capability to monitor specific telemetry elements real-time, and record all telemetry elements for future review and processing.

Requirements: provide the capability to monitor specific telemetry elements real-time, and record all telemetry elements for future review and processing

requirements reference: provide the capability to monitor specific telemetry elements real-time, and record all telemetry elements for future review and processing

Requirements: displaying fuel parameters to the operator to include as a minimum, remaining fuel, flow rate, and bingo fuel

requirements reference: displaying fuel parameters to the operator to include as a minimum, remaining fuel, flow rate, and bingo fuel
displaying fuel parameters to the operator to include as a minimum, remaining fuel, flow rate, and bingo fuel

Requirements: interactive display for the purpose of controlling the data link terminal

requirements reference: interactive display for the purpose of controlling the data link terminal
requirements constraints: interactive display for the purpose of controlling the data link terminal

text: The Tactical Control System shall receive, process, and present status data to the operator so that the status of the data terminal and the supported AV data link can be monitored.

text: Payload data includes the digital and analog imagery and associated telemetry sent to the Tactical Control System from each of these payloads.

The Tactical Control System shall provide information to the C4I system, utilizing data obtained from drones (non-real-time trajectories, tactical points, and details), for use by C4I system operators. This information is transmitted via tactical data communication links and is available for engagement by appropriate weapon systems.

Requirements: provide information to the C4I system

text: The Tactical Control System shall have the capability to establish and subsequently terminate digital communication with peripheral devices.

Requirements: to establish and subsequently terminate digital communication

text: All digital messages received by the Tactical Control System shall be automatically checked for errors and corrected when possible.

Requirements: automatically checked for errors and corrected when possible

text: As a minimum, Tactical Control System shall provide Startup FD/L for the operator workstation.

Requirements: provide Startup FD/L for the operator workstation

text: The Tactical Control System shall allow the operator to control and monitor the AV's FD/L, if required and provided by the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM).

Requirements: allow the operator to control and monitor the AV's FD/L

text: The Tactical Control System shall allow authorized operators to install software upgrades via CD-ROM as well as other media storage devices.

Requirements: allow authorized operators to install software upgrades via CD-ROM as well as other media storage devices

text: The Tactical Control System shall be capable of importing National Imagery Mapping Agency (NIMA) Digital Terrain Elevation Data (DTED), Digital Feature Analysis Data (DFAD), Arc Digitized Raster Graphic and scanned hard copy maps, via compact disk.

Requirements: capable of importing

text: The Tactical Control System will interface with external systems to conduct mission coordination and operations.

Shared Phenomena: to conduct mission coordination and operations

interface: to conduct mission coordination and operations

text: This prioritization schema has been validated by a Joint Requirements Oversight Council (JROC) Memorandum.
The Tactical Control System shall support a concurrent uplink and downlink capability.

Requirements: support a concurrent uplink and downlink

text: The RTP interface shall support distributed processing capability.
The Tactical Control System shall incorporate an intercom system that provides verbal communicate in the situation where there are multiple operators.

Requirements: incorporate an intercom system

text: The Tactical Control System shall, as a minimum, allow the Operator(s) to print freeze-frame video, C4I Messages, Mission Plans, FD/L information, and current map display to an internal printer.

Requirements: allow the Operator(s) to print freeze-frame video, C4I Messages, Mission Plans, FD/L information, and current map display to an internal printer

text: Appropriate cautions and warnings shall be provided to the operator if the air vehicle deviates into unsafe flight regime.

Requirements: provided to the operator

text: The system design shall use MIL-STD-2036, as a guide, with regard to personnel hazards, and MIL-STD-1472D, as a guide for safety from a human engineering viewpoint.

Requirements: shall use MIL-STD-2036

Requirements: provides aircraft flight data or payload data in the foreground

text: The Tactical Control System shall have ergonomically designed operator controls and displays for the 5th percentile female to 95th percentile male operator.

displays for the 5th percentile female to 95th percentile male operator

Requirements: color coded and flashed

Machine Domain: The color codes and flash frequencies

text: In addition to displayed alert messages to the Tactical Control System operator, auditory alerts to include tones shall also be provided.
The Tactical Control System shall use graphical representations to convey information, such as system status, C4I links, and AV-GDT links.

Requirements: use graphical representations to convey information

text: The Tactical Control System shall provide maximum automated system software support to system status monitoring and alerting of the Tactical Control System operator when a preset system parameter goes under as well as over a set threshold.

Requirements: provide maximum automated system software support to system status monitoring and alerting of the Tactical Control System operator

text: The Tactical Control System HCI shall provide for separation, grouping, and visual coding of multiple categories of alerts, to include Warnings, Cautions, and Advisories.

Requirements: provide for separation, grouping, and visual coding of multiple categories of alerts

text: New systems that are deployed (based on the ITS standards) will not utilize the project defined protocol but will be moved “into” the cloud (because they themselves would be based on the ITS standards.
